title.narrative: Provision of quality comprehensive and life- saving support for GBV survivors among the most vulnerable people in West Darfur

description.narrative:
The project is targeting 12,715 most vulnerable beneficiaries in Al Geneina, including 8900 women, 3433 girls and 610 persons with disabilities, through providing quality multi-sectoral GBV response services following a survivor-centered approach, as well as GBV prevention measures. This project aims at preventing the risks of violence and mitigating the violence-related consequences for the most vulnerable women and girls and boys in the affected areas through mitigating the life-threatening consequences for the GBV survivors and increasing access to effective multi-sectoral GBV related measures in order to prevent an increase in the risk of life-threatening GBV.
The project will focus on information sessions to create a wider awareness among the most vulnerable populations about the life-threatening risks of GBV and available services, with distribution of Dignity Kits to ensure dignity of the affected women and girls, which also serves to mitigate the increased risks to GBV. Furthermore, by establishing Women’s Safe Spaces, it will also sensitize the communities about GBV and access to relevant information, as well as to help reduce life-threatening risks of GBV and prevent further harm during the rapid emergency response phase.
